event.name: RVS_ABANDONED_MINING_TOWN
event.text:
You have arrived to what appears to be what is left of an old mining colony that has long since been abandoned. Sandblasted buildings nestled in the craters of the asteroids loom eerily in the dense smog that now fills this beacon. The flourishing mining town must have been quickly abandoned when the asteroids started belching toxic fumes due to reckless mining and exploitation.
Though your shields are holding up to the thicker debris, they were not calibrated to deal with the microparticles in the smog and your engine begins to sputter and weaken.

event.name: RVS_ABANDONED_MINING_TOWN_SCRAPYARD
event.text: Though the mines have been inert and lifeless for many years. Something catches your attention: lights flickering deep within the haze where the debris appears to be thickest. With the swirling clouds forming a brief clearing, you can see that those lights mark the perimeter of a scrapyard of sorts. Perhaps there are riches unclaimed hidden within.

You decide to investigate the scrapyard and take a closer look. On your approach you are hailed by a ramshackled station amidst the debris by those who still call this beacon their home. They welcome you to their scrapyard and offer you to browse their wares for sale. Or if you feel lucky you could try and see what you could uncover at the scrapyard.

choice.text: Head to the station to trade.

event.text: You dock at the small station and take your time perusing at your leisure.
There is nothing of interest at this beacon worth your time to investigate in this smog. You order to charge the FTL drive.

event.name: RVS_AMT_SCRAPYARD_STANDARD
event.text: Despite the thick polution and debris at this beacon your exploration of the field depths turns out to be rather successful all things considered. You managed to collect a worthwhile amount of usable materials, before your engines gets worse in this smog.

event.name: RVS_AMT_SCRAPYARD_FREIGHTER_FUEL
event.text: Within the clouds of the scrapyard you can barely make out the silhouette of a pre-multiversal travel era Federation freighter that appears mostly intact More importantly, its fuel reserves are still present and in quite plentiful supply. You managed to collect a worthwhile amount of usable materials, before your engines gets worse in this smog.

event.name: RVS_AMT_SCRAPYARD_FREIGHTER_SUS
event.text: Within the clouds of the scrapyard you discover a cargo freighter that appears mostly intact. You locate a sealed container within the hold, however on inspection your crew realises it's wired up to an explosive trap. It might be possible to disarm the trap and secure whatever may be inside.

choice.text: It's not worth it, leave with what we've found so far.

event.text: Your haul prior to this is sufficient enough. You get onboard your ship and decide to depart before your engine succumbs to the choking haze.

textList.name: RVS_SCRAPYARD_TRAP_TEXT
textList.text: A loud beeping sound echoes throughout the cargo bay as the trap is triggered, but the noise quickly dies down to the tune of an expired power source. That was a close call.
Your volunteer's quick moves enabled the trap to be deactivated granting you access to the container's contents.
The trap triggers with a loud beeping sound, but the sound soon dies down as the power source expires. That was too close for comfort.

In the freighters cargo bay, loud beeping emanates as your volunteer triggers the trap! Fortunately the beeping dies down nearly immediately as the powersource rapidly drains. Looks like your volunteer will live another day.

Your crew member simply stares at the container, before battering down the door with their shoulder. You are caught off guard and dumbfounded by what you just witnessed. Before you could bark at them you could hear them yell from inside that it was merely a dud. You can't tell if that was stupidity or bravery and you opt to not dwell on it further.

textList.name: RVS_SCRAPYARD_TRAP_FAIL_TEXT
textList.text: The freighter explodes in a blase of fury, catching your crew member between the collapsing structure leaving only but a short screaming on the comms followed by static. A grim reminder of the dangers and perils that come with every choice you make but on the bright side at least your cruiser wasn't damaged in the explosion, you prepare to depart before anything else decides to take a turn for the worst in this forsaken system.

The cargo ship explodes in a blaze of fury after a single tense beep, blasting your crew member and a section of the freighter apart into a debris field. You make preperations to depart before anything worse happens.

textList.name: RVS_SCRAPYARD_BYPASS_TRAP_TEXT
textList.text: Your crew is able to slip easily into the container, where they find and defuse the explosives with ease. With the container being now safe you easily take its contents aboard.
Without any concern for the trap activating your crew disarms the explosive. Looks like a pretty hefty haul.
The beeping noises of the trap dies down slowly after being deactivated by your crew. Leaving the container silent as you salvage its contents.
You are still concerned about the safety of your crew even after they disarmed the bomb and gave a go ahead. Though once the goods are brought onboard and secured you can begin to relax again.

event.name: RVS_AMT_SCRAPYARD_FREIGHTER_TRADE
event.text: Within the clouds of the scrapyard you discover a cargo freighter that appears mostly destroyed. However on closer inspection you discover a cargo container sticking halfway out of a breach in the hull, its contents remaining intact. You give the order to drag the find into the cargo bay.

event.name: RVS_AMT_SCRAPYARD_COLONY_SHIP
event.text: Despite the thick polution and debris at this beacon you can immediatly spot what appears to be the hulking mass of what was most likely a colony ship that most likely seeded this solar system with life before it was driven away by the intense pollution. You managed to collect as much useable materials from the ships frame as you can, however, you could spend more time collecting debris from this hulk here at the risk of becoming stranded here.

choice.text: Take the risk and spend more time gathering materials.

event.text: It's not worth it, leave with what we've found so far.

You spend a considerable amount of time delving deeper into the hulk. Meticulously cutting up and disassembling useful components from the ships engineering and gargantuan life support. You come off with a pretty decent haul and fortunately your engines haven't seem to have worsened. You best leave before the Rebel fleet gains any more ground on you.

You come off with a pretty decent haul, however, your engines begin to choke and stall on the polutants of this beacon. Cleaning out the engines and repairing them will take time, time that you can't afford to lose as the Rebel fleet continues their advance.
